AI Weather Quest: Pre-Competition Webinar (morning slot)

22 July 2025 – 22 July 2025

ECMWF Online

Speakers: Olga Loegel (ECMWF)

The ECMWF AI Weather Quest is an international competition leveraging artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) to advance weather forecasting.

During the Competitive Phase, starting on 14 August 2025, participating teams will submit weekly real-time sub-seasonal forecasts using their AI models. ECMWF will evaluate these submissions using the Ranked Probability Skill Score (RPSS) and display top-performing results each week on the AI Weather Quest website.

To help participants prepare, ECMWF is hosting two interactive one-hour webinars on 22 July 2025. The sessions are identical—participants are invited to register for the one that best suits their time zone.

Each session will feature:

An update on the number of teams registered for the competition.

Key insights from the JJA Testing Period (15 May – 13 August 2025).

An overview of the Competitive Phase, including a deep dive into the forecasts visualisation portal as well as how results will be displayed.

A live Q&A session with the organisers.

Speakers: Olga Loegel (ECMWF), Joshua Talib (ECMWF).

Please note: This webinar will be recorded. By registering, you consent to the recording and understand that the recording may be shared with attendees and for future reference.

Morning slot

Tuesday 22 July 2025 8:00 - 9:00 UTC

[Link to register]

Please note that another time slot (14:00 - 15:00 UTC) is offered to accommodate participants across different time zones, this is the same webinar offered at two different times. More information here.

https://events.ecmwf.int/event/476/

Impact Orbit Creative Group

Impact Orbit Creative Group is a multi-disciplinary consultancy and innovation hub focused on driving sustainable growth, digital transformation, and impact-led strategies in the space and technology sectors. We partner with organisations and startups worldwide to deliver strategic guidance, communications expertise, and frameworks for responsible innovation.
